column3: Description
An array of the device ids that you want to report on
Similar to graphTypes for the standard graph, an array of values you want to show in the graph
A time based limiter, to limit time data, e.g. 2 will show 1/2 the time labels, 5 will show 20% of the time labels
Specifies how many labels (ticks) to display on the X axis, this does not limit the data in the graph
Scales the graph with standard 'linear' scale, or 'logarithmic', an algorithm to ensure all data can be seen
colors the graph's title icons
If line graph, this fills the graph, it is an array for each dataset
This is actually the width of the line
Use if you want a dashed line, it takes an array of two values; length of the line and the space
Handy for bar graphs, takes an array of colors like datasetColors
The size of each data point
An array of the shape of each point, such as circle|cross|dash|line|rect|star|triangle
An array containing the color of each point
An array containing the border color of each point
The thickness of the point's border
If a bar graph, this is the width of each bar, 0-1, so 0.5 is half bar, half gap
Use this if you want to reverse your X axis, i.e. setting 'true' would mean the time will be reversed
Sets the bezier curve the line is, 0 is straight, 1 is extremely curved
An array stating the order in which each dataset should be added to the graph for "last hours"
An array stating the order in which each dataset should be added to the graph for "today"
An array stating the order in which each dataset should be added to the graph for "last month"
A string containing the color of the buttons border
A string containing the ccolor of the buttons text
A string containing the ccolor of the buttons background color
A string containing the ccolor of the buttons icon
A number specifying the gap (or margin) between the buttons (left and right)
A number specifying the gap (or margin) above and below the buttons
A number specifying the padding inside the buttons (left and right)
A number specifying the padding inside the buttons, top and bottom
A number specifying the curveture of the corners of the buttons
A string containing the the shadow below the button in RGBA format
A number specifying the size of the button
An array for the text displayed on each button
